message: Hello?
Good morning, you're through to
the DVLA. How can I assist you today?
Hi, yeah I need to reapply for my
driving license. I had to surrender
it about 6 months ago but I want to get it back now.
Okay, no problem. I can help you with that process. Can I start by getting some details from you?
Yep, go ahead.
What is your full name please?
James Alan Smith.
And your date of birth?
3rd of May 1982.
Thank you. And what was the reason you had to surrender your license previously?
Uh, well it was for medical reasons. Some
issues with my eyesight, I think it was cataracts or something like that.
I see, okay. And have those medical issues been resolved now?
Yeah, I had surgery a few months back and
my vision is all sorted out according to my doctor.
That's good to hear. So in that case, you should be able to reapply for your license.
Great, so what do I need to do?
First, you'll need to fill out the D1 application form and any relevant medical forms related to your eyesight condition.
Okay, do you have those forms or do I need to get them somewhere else?
You can order a D1 pack from the DVLA which will have all the forms you need included. Would you like me to order that for you?
Yeah that would be great if you could, thanks.
No problem at all. Can I just confirm your current address to send the pack to?
Yeah it's 24 Acacia Avenue,
Birmingham, B12 4TP.
Got it, 24 Acacia Avenue, Birmingham, B12 4TP. I've ordered that D1 pack to be sent to that address.
Brilliant, thanks. So I just fill that out and send it back in then?
Not quite, there are a few extra steps. Once you've filled out the forms, you'll need to get your doctor to complete the medical section confirming you meet the vision standards for driving again.
Right okay, I can do that no problem.
Great. Then you'll need to send the completed forms along with any supporting medical evidence back to the DVLA's Drivers Medical Group.
Okay got it. And how long does it usually take once I've sent it all in?
It can take around 4 weeks for them to process everything. However, if your case needs to be referred to one of our medical advisors for review, it may take a bit longer.
4 weeks?!
Oh man, I was hoping it would be quicker than that.
I understand your frustration, but the medical review is an important step to ensure you are fit to drive again safely.
Yeah I know, it's just I really need to be able to drive for my job and all. This is such a pain.
I appreciate this is an inconvenience for you. Is there anything else I can clarify about the process?
No, you've explained it all clearly enough.
I'll just have to wait it out I guess.
Okay, well the D1 pack should arrive within the next few days. Once you have that, you can get started on filling out the forms and getting the medical section completed.
Alright, thanks for your help anyway.
You're welcome. I wish you the best with getting your license reinstated. Is there anything else I can assist with today?
No that's it, thanks.
Okay, thank you for calling the DVLA. Take care.
Yeah, bye.
